meanings.sent1: After running, the tired dog huffed loudly.
meanings.sent2: She huffed after climbing the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The old steam engine huffed as it chugged along the tracks.
meanings.sent4: The wind huffed through the trees, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The exhausted hiker huffed and puffed up the mountain trail.

meanings.definition: To express annoyance or anger by exhaling loudly
meanings.sent1: Feeling frustrated, she huffed in irritation.
meanings.sent2: He huffed in annoyance when his computer froze.
meanings.sent3: The child huffed when told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The cat huffed at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent5: She huffed out her displeasure at the long wait in line.

meanings.definition: To puff out or swell up in a show of anger or annoyance
meanings.sent1: The cat huffed up its fur when approached by the unfamiliar dog.
meanings.sent2: He huffed out his chest in a display of confidence.
meanings.sent3: The balloon huffed up as it was filled with air.
meanings.sent4: The angry bird huffed up its feathers to appear larger.
meanings.sent5: The child huffed up his cheeks in a playful manner.
